Source: materials/ImageLoader.mjs

/**
 * @description Asyncronosly loads an image and retives its width, height, and ImageData.
 *
 * @param {String} url The url of the image to be loaded.
 * @returns {Promise<TextureImage,Error>}
 */

export async function loadImageAsync(url){
    return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {

        let img = new Image();
        img.crossOrigin = 'Anonymous'
        img.onload = () => {

            let tempCanv = document.createElement('canvas');
            tempCanv.width = img.width;
            tempCanv.height = img.height;
            let tmpCtx = tempCanv.getContext('2d');
            tmpCtx.drawImage(img,0,0);
            
            resolve({
                width:  img.width,
                height: img.height,
                imageData: tmpCtx.getImageData(0,0,img.width,img.height)
            })
        }
        img.onerror = (e) => {
            reject(e)
        }
        img.src = url;
    })
}
